top_pain_points.pain: Need unified platform for both MLOps and LLMOps as GenAI adoption grows
top_pain_points.example_quote: > unified platform to do both, MLOps and LLMOps

top_pain_points.pain: Security requirements are stringent - few vendors pass their security reviews
top_pain_points.example_quote: > security is a bigger hurdle and not many vendors have passed

top_pain_points.pain: Need end-to-end tracing, evals, and datasets with proper team access controls
top_pain_points.example_quote: > end to end tracing, evals, datasets - concern on teams and their structures and how teams access data in platform

top_pain_points.pain: Integration complexity - getting data in via SDK/integrations is a challenge
top_pain_points.example_quote: > integrations and getting data in - SDK / Integrations

winning_value_props.value: Single platform supporting both traditional ML and LLM observability
Enterprise-grade security that passes stringent telco requirements
Role-based access controls and team-aware data management
Flexible SDK and integrations for complex telco data pipelines

common_objections.objection: We have strict security requirements that most vendors can't meet
common_objections.effective_response: We work with major telcos including TELUS, AT&T, and Vodafone. Arize is SOC2 compliant and can deploy in your VPC or private cloud. We've passed security reviews for some of the most stringent enterprise environments.

common_objections.objection: We have separate teams using different tools for ML vs LLM
common_objections.effective_response: That fragmentation is exactly the pain TELUS was facing. Arize provides a unified platform with proper access controls so teams can work independently while leadership gets consolidated visibility.

common_objections.objection: Our data infrastructure is complex - integration will be difficult
common_objections.effective_response: We've integrated with complex telco data pipelines at multiple carriers. Our SDK is designed for flexibility, and our team provides hands-on implementation support.

discovery_questions.question: Are your teams currently using separate tools for traditional ML monitoring vs your new LLM/GenAI workloads?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_yes: Is that fragmentation creating blind spots or operational overhead?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_no: Are you planning to adopt GenAI in the near term?

discovery_questions.question: How are you handling security and compliance requirements for ML observability tools?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_yes: What's been the biggest challenge with vendor security reviews?

discovery_questions.question: How are different teams (central ML platform, LOB data scientists) currently accessing and sharing model observability data?
discovery_questions.follow_up_if_yes: Are access controls meeting your governance requirements?

discovery_questions.question: What's been your experience integrating monitoring tools with your existing data pipelines?
